column4: how can I copy the home directory to a USB stick from the terminal?
cp /home/user /media/usbdev
omitting directory /home/user - what does this mean?
cp -r makes it copy subdirectories aswell, might be what you want. :)
no problem
cannot create directory /media/usbdev read only file system - Ideas?
mount the USB with privileges to write to it as user, or try to do the copy as rot / with sudo
: I tried sudo but it is the same. How do I mount with privilages?
what is the filesystem on the usb?
msdos 4gb usb stick - Does that mean it is fat16?
fat16 or fat32 i guess. are you using cli och x?
terminal i would guess, just double checking
Using the terminal
how do you mount the usb?
I didn't?
sudo bash & mkdir /mnt/usb & mount /dev/yourusb /mnt/usb
this is the end of the internet.
yes, but in the last command, replace 'yourusb/ with the actual device, like sdb1 or so
How do I find what the actual devise is called?
dunplug it, type tail -f /var/log/messages, reinsert it and look for it
but now i arrived at work, cant help you more. sorry.
